Fear.text: Do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
Fear.explanation: God is telling you not to be afraid or discouraged, because He is right there with you. He’s your protector and your source of strength. No matter what you’re going through, He promises to give you the support and help you need, holding you up with His powerful and faithful hand.

Fear.text: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
Fear.explanation: Even when you go through the hardest, scariest times in life—times that feel dark and dangerous—you won’t be afraid, because you know God is right there with you. His guidance and protection give you peace and reassurance.

Fear.text: For God did not give us a spirit of fear, but of power and love and of a sound mind.
Fear.explanation: God does not give us a spirit of fear or timidity. Instead, He gives us strength, love, and self-discipline so we can face challenges with courage, compassion, and a clear mind.

Fear.text: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
Fear.explanation: Because the Lord gives guidance, protection, and strength, there is no reason to live in fear. With God as our defender and source of security, we can face anything with confidence.

Fear.text: There is no fear in love, but love casts out fear; because fear involves punishment, and the one who fears has not been perfected in love.
Fear.explanation: True, mature love—especially God's perfect love—drives out fear, particularly the fear of judgment. When we fully understand and live in God’s love, we no longer live in fear because we know we are secure in Him.

Fear.text: When I am afraid, I will trust in you.
Fear.explanation: When fear arises, the response is to place trust in God. This verse is a simple but powerful reminder that faith in God is the answer to fear.

Fear.text: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous; do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.
Fear.explanation: God tells us to be brave and not let fear or worry take over, because He is always by our side to help and guide us. With Him, we don’t have to face tough situations alone.

Fear.text: You must not fear them, for the Lord your God Himself fights for you.
Fear.explanation: God tells His people not to be afraid of their enemies because He is the one who will fight and protect them. They can trust that God is on their side, so there’s no need to fear.

Fear.text: So we say with confidence, “The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?
Fear.explanation: Because God helps and supports us, we don’t need to be afraid of what others might do. With God on our side, there’s no reason to live in fear.

Fear.text: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth give way and the mountains fall into the heart of the sea, though its waters roar and foam and the mountains quake with their surging.
Fear.explanation: God is a safe place and a strong helper when we face difficulties. Even if everything around us seems to fall apart or be chaotic, we don’t have to be afraid because God is with us and will protect us.

Fear.text: You came near when I called you, and you said: Do not fear.
Fear.explanation: When I called out to God in my trouble, He responded and comforted me, telling me not to be afraid. God is close and ready to help whenever we reach out to Him.

Fear.text: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
Fear.explanation: Jesus offers us a special kind of peace—calm and lasting—that’s different from what the world offers. Because of this, we don’t need to be worried or afraid in our hearts.

Fear.text: Jesus says: Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.
Fear.explanation: Jesus tells His followers not to be afraid because God, their loving Father, is happy to give them His kingdom. They are cared for and valued, so there’s no need for fear.

Fear.text: This is what I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt. And my Spirit remains among you. Do not fear.
Fear.explanation: God reminds His people that just as He promised when He brought them out of Egypt, His Spirit is still with them. Because of His ongoing presence, they don’t need to be afraid.

Fear.text: For I am the Lord your God who takes hold of your right hand and says to you, Do not fear; I will help you.
Fear.explanation: God promises to hold and guide you personally. Because He is your helper, you don’t need to be afraid. He is always there to support you.

Joy.text: Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again: Rejoice!
Joy.explanation: Be joyful in your relationship with God all the time—no matter what’s happening. In fact, it's so important, Paul says it twice: keep choosing joy.

Joy.text: You make known to me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence, with eternal pleasures at your right hand.
Joy.explanation: God shows you the way to truly live, and being close to Him brings deep, lasting joy. With Him, there’s fullness of life now and forever.

Sadness.text: The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
Sadness.explanation: God stays near to those who are hurting deeply, and He rescues people who feel completely overwhelmed or broken inside.

Sadness.text: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
Sadness.explanation: Jesus is inviting you to bring your sadness, stress, or heavy heart to Him. He promises to give you peace and rest—not just physical, but deep, inner rest for your soul.

Anger.text: In your anger do not sin”: Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry.
Anger.explanation: It’s okay to feel angry sometimes—but don’t let that anger lead you to do something wrong. And don’t hold onto it for too long; deal with it before the day ends.

Anger.text: My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry, because human anger does not produce the righteousness that God desires.
Anger.explanation: Be willing to really listen, don’t rush to speak your mind, and don’t get angry easily—because when we let anger take over, we’re not living the way God wants us to.

Anxiety.text: Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
Anxiety.explanation: Don’t let worry take over. Instead, talk to God about everything—bring your concerns to Him with a thankful heart. When you do that, God will give you a deep peace that doesn’t always make sense but will protect your heart and mind through Jesus.

Anxiety.text: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.
Anxiety.explanation: Give all your worries and fears to God—completely let go of them—because He genuinely cares about you and what you’re going through.

Gratitude.text: Give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
Gratitude.explanation: Be thankful no matter what’s going on in your life. God wants you to have a heart of gratitude through everything because it helps you trust Him and stay connected to His plan.

Gratitude.text: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
Gratitude.explanation: Thank God because He is always good, and His love never ends—it lasts forever.

Peace.text: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
Peace.explanation: Jesus is offering you His peace, a peace that’s different from what the world can give. It’s not based on circumstances. So, don’t let worry or fear take over—He’s giving you a deeper, lasting peace.

Peace.text: You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds are steadfast, because they trust in you.
Peace.explanation: God promises to give complete, unshakable peace to those who stay focused on Him and trust Him fully.
